hey "mac_davis" or anyone else... how do you get download speeds to be that insane? I cant seem to exceed 70 (which happened once)... im usually at like 2-30 kb/s ... i've had my dl and up load both set on unlimited and i have my own internet ( i dont take it from someone else). I use a router (lynksis) .. am i doing anything wrong? can I fix or optimize anything??

danga294

It sounds as if you have a NAT configuration issue with your router (port forwarding) - setting this correctly will significantly increase your download speeds. To find more about this, try using Google to search for something like ''how do I increase my BitTorrent download speed'' - Also, have a look at your Lynksis documentation to see if this has a section on the port-forwarding setting. - Hope this info. helps

danga294

Another point is that I would not have your upload speed set to unlimited (this will hog your bandwith and slow your downloads) - you will need to find a happy medium which will depend on your broadband speed (eg 2MB, 4MB, etc) - for example, I believe that on a 2MB pipe, a good setting is 'unlimited download but limiting the upload to approx 25 KB/s' - unless, of course if you are seeding - then give the upload all you can
For you with problems like "Adobe Acrobat 8 cannot launch at this time. You need at least one other suite application" See this: http://www.adobe.com/cfusion/knowledgebase/index.cfm?id=kb400590
Downloaded ok. Works first time. No problems at all.

installed fine on OSX

I have installed this on a G4 (non-Intel) Mac running Max OS X 10.4 (Tiger) and it works great!
The install for this is fairly self-explanatory thanks to a well designed .dmg file.
First, double click the .dmg file.  Then, do as the picture suggests...drag the picture of an Adobe folder there in the middle of that window to your Applications folder.
Once that finishes copying (it's around 902mb) open the Adobe Acrobat Profession 8 file in that folder that just finished copying ("Adobe Acrobat 8 Professional")
From the install menu, there's a note about a serial key in an .rtf file.  I used that and it worked fine.
If that doesn't work for you, just check out Serial Box for a key.
Remember, don't register.  It wouldn't be a bad idea to get Little Snitch (demo mode is free) and use that, just in case.
-Minerva
